  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute(Battleship.PlayerHandler playerHandler, Battleship game)
      Executes the PLACE PreparationCommand to place each Ship in the map. Calls methods setPosition and placeShipInMap, and checks position validations.
      Specified by:
      execute in interface CommandHandler
      Parameters:
      playerHandler - receives a PlayerHandler as parameter.
      game - receives a Battleship representing a game as parameter.

    • removeFromMap

      private void removeFromMap(Ship ship, List<List<String>> myMap)
      It removes the Ship from the map by replacing the String on each location it occupies for the default String of the map.
      Parameters:
      ship - receives a Ship as parameter.
      myMap - receives List of a List of Strings representing a map.

    • placeShipInMap

      private void placeShipInMap(Ship ship, List<List<String>> myMap)
      It draws the Ship on the map by replacing the String on each location for the String that represents that specific Ship type.
      Parameters:
      ship - receives a Ship as parameter.
      myMap - receives List of a List of Strings representing a map.

    • checkIfValidPosition

      private void checkIfValidPosition(Battleship.PlayerHandler playerHandler, Ship ship) throws InvalidPositionException
      Check's if the Ship fits on those coordinates of the map.
      Parameters:
      playerHandler - receives a PlayerHandler representing a player.
      ship - receives a Ship.
      Throws:
      InvalidPositionException - if the String of that position on the map is not equal to '~', or if the row and column for any part of the Ship go off the boundaries of the map.

    • getPlacementPosition

      private int[] getPlacementPosition(String message, List<Ship> shipList) throws InvalidSyntaxException
      Takes the input message and returns an array of ints representing the Ship that is being placed, and the row and column for the intended location.
      Parameters:
      message - receives a String representing the message input.
      shipList - receives a List of Ships as in the Ships owned by that player.
      Returns:
      returns an array of ints.
      Throws:
      InvalidSyntaxException - if the int representing the Ship is bigger than the List of Ships owned by the player.

    • checkValidInput

      private void checkValidInput(String[] separated) throws InvalidSyntaxException
      Check's if the user input is valid.
      Parameters:
      separated - receives an array of String as parameter.
      Throws:
      InvalidSyntaxException - throws InvalidSyntaxException if that array is not of length 4, if the second or third index of that array is not a number, and if the fourth index of that array is not a char between A and Z.
